intro: Cusparia fontanesiana, commonly known as the Fontanesiana spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
